concise_definition: n. 承诺, 许诺; v. 有希望, 承诺

definitions.explanation_en: A declaration or assurance that one will do something or that a particular thing will happen, often involving a moral or legal obligation.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指一个人做出的声明或保证，表示自己将做某事或某事将会发生，通常带有道德或法律上的义务。
definitions.example_en: She made a promise to visit her grandmother every weekend.
definitions.example_cn: 她承诺每个周末都去看望祖母。

definitions.explanation_en: A sign or indication that something good or desirable is likely to happen in the future.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指某种迹象或征兆，表明未来可能发生令人满意或美好的事情。
definitions.example_en: The young athlete shows great promise in track and field.
definitions.example_cn: 这位年轻运动员在田径项目上展现出巨大的潜力。

definitions.explanation_en: To commit oneself to doing something or to ensure that something will occur, often to gain trust or confidence.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指承诺自己将做某事，或确保某事会发生，通常是为了赢得信任或信心。
definitions.example_en: He promised to finish the report by Friday.
definitions.example_cn: 他承诺会在周五前完成报告。

definitions.explanation_en: To indicate or suggest the likelihood of a favorable outcome or potential.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指暗示或表明某事有良好结果或潜力的可能性。
definitions.example_en: These new materials promise to revolutionize the construction industry.
definitions.example_cn: 这些新材料有望彻底改变建筑行业。

comparison.analysis: “Pledge”（誓言/保证）比 “promise” 更正式、更庄重，常用于公共场合、法律或道德层面的郑重承诺，如捐款 pledge、参军 pledge。它强调严肃性和不可违背性，而 “promise” 更日常、更口语化，适用范围更广。
“Assurance”（保证）侧重于消除疑虑，提供信心，通常由一方向另一方传达确定性，不一定包含未来行动的承诺。例如：'I give you my assurance that this is safe.' 而 “promise” 更强调主动承担义务去完成某事。
“Potential”（潜力）与 “promise” 作为名词时部分重叠，都指未来可能实现的优秀表现。但 “potential” 是中性客观描述，仅表示能力或可能性；而 “promise” 带有积极评价和期待色彩，隐含了对未来的乐观判断。例如：'He has potential' 是陈述事实；'He shows promise' 则是赞赏。
